greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n*(2*n-3).
comment: Positive terms give a bisection of A000096. - _Omar E. Pol_, Dec 16 2016
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
Emily Barnard, Nathan Reading, Coxeter-biCatalan combinatorics, arXiv:1605.03524 [math.CO], 2016. See p. 51.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (3,-3,1).
formula: a(n) = A033537(n) - 8*n^2; A100035(a(n)) = 2 for n > 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 31 2004
a(n) = a(n-1) + 4*n - 5 with a(0) = 0. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 20 2010
a(n) = (2*n-1)*(n-1) - 1. Also, with an initial offset of -1, a(n) = (2*n-1)*(n+1) = 2*n^2 + n - 1. - _Alonso del Arte_, Dec 15 2012
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
